note.text: Older versions of FortiWeb are subject to three vulnerabilities: 1. OS command injection: A WebUI administrator user may run system commands when executing a report 2. Reflected XSS: A WebUI administrator user may perform a reflected XSS attack via an improperly sanitized parameter in the FortiWeb auto update service page 3. Password field with autocomplete enabled: The WebUI FTP backup page contains a password field with HTML form autocomplete enabled
note.title: Description

note.text: XSS, OS command injection, autocomplete in html form
note.title: Impact

note.text: The Reflected XSS impacts FortiWeb versions between 5.0.0 and 5.3.4 included.The OS command injection and the password field with autocomplete enabled impact all supported FortiWeb versions lower than 5.3.5.
note.title: Affected Products

note.text: Upgrade to FortiWeb 5.3.5 or higher.Workaround:Associate administrators to a limited access profile with none or read-only privileges for the following pages:- Maintenance- System Configuration- Log & report
note.title: Solutions
